New Records: India comfortably reached 179-1 in 17 overs of the fourth T20 international after West Indies chose to bat first and scored a respectable 178-8.
Yashasvi Jaiswal hit 84 not out in 51 balls and fellow opener Shubman Gill added 77 in 47 deliveries to make the series-levelling win almost inevitable for India after an opening stand of 165.
Key Match Events: India comfortably reached 179-1 in 17 overs of the fourth T20 international after West Indies chose to bat first and scored a respectable 178-8.
Yashasvi Jaiswal hit 84 not out in 51 balls and fellow opener Shubman Gill added 77 in 47 deliveries to make the series-levelling win almost inevitable for India after an opening stand of 165.
Shimron Hetmyer hit a 39-ball 61, including three fours and four sixes, and Shai Hope got 45 in 29.
Spinner Kuldeep Yadav (2-26) claimed two wickets for two runs in his first over, dismissing Nicholas Pooran (1) and West Indies captain Rovman Powell (1).
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies won the second T20, also at Providence Stadium, by two wickets after the hosts also won the opener by four runs in Tarouba, Trinidad.
Post-Match Reflections: The teams meet again at Central Broward Stadium in the series decider on Sunday, with India having rallied from trailing 2-0.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The T20 games are taking place at an interesting time for the sport's prospects in the U.S., where Major League Cricket launched last month.
Others: The T20 World Cup featuring the worldâ€™s best international teams is set be co-hosted by the U.S. and West Indies next year.
